content: positive pickle by emily thomas @magicalthinkingknits everyone can use a little positive pick-me-up this little guy is here to cheer you on and tell you that you re a big dill finished size approx 4in tall by 2 in wide stitches materials mc - magic_ring single_crochet - single_crochet green worsted weight yarn of choice increase - increase two single_crochet in one stitch suggested loops & threads impeccable in decrease - decrease crochet two stitches together sphagnum kelly green or fern flo - front loops only used in decrease 3 25 mm/d-3 crochet hook ** - repeat the instructions inside the stars stitch marker sts - stitches safety eyes xsts - stitches at the end of the row black embroidery floss darning needle arms make 2 16 *single_crochet* x24 24sts or 16-optional crochet arms in line they can be 1 mc 6sc pull to close loop do not join this sewn on after as well *single_crochet* x4 picking up the first project is done in a spiral so continue directly in arm single_crochet through the top of both sts and the next to the next sts for row 2 6sts sts single_crochet through the next two sts of the arm and the 2-7 6sc next sts single_crochet through the last two sts on the arm and bind off leaving a tail the next sts *single_crochet*x10 picking up the first arm single_crochet through the top of both sts and the next sts single_crochet body through the next two sts of the arm and the next 1 mc 6sc pull to close loop do not join this sts single_crochet through the last two sts on the arm and the project is done in a spiral so continue directly in next sts *single_crochet*x4 24sts to the next sts for row 2 place marker 6sts 17-20 *single_crochet* x24 24sts 2 *increase* x 6 12sts 21 *single_crochet single_crochet decrease flo* x6 18sts 3 *single_crochet increase* x6 18sts 22 *single_crochet decrease flo* x6 12sts 4 *single_crochet single_crochet increase* x6 24sts place safety eyes between 17 and 18 2sts apart 5-15 *single_crochet* x24 24sts sew on smile using black embroidery thread stuff 23 *decrease flo* x6 6sts 24 bind off and sew up top booty optional to give your positive pickle a booty cut a length of yarn about 5-7in long and thread it in your darning needle insert the needle in the center of the mc in row 1 of the body pop the needle out on the back of the pickle about 10 row up pull the yarn through but leave an inch or so for a tail insert the needle back in to the mc in row 1 and then back out the same spot as before pull the yarn as tight as possible this will start to create visible booty cheeks repeat this process two of three more times then tie off and sew in any remaining ends positive pickle sign make a sign with a positive saying out of cardstock or notecards and
